metadata.title: Supporting Information Polycyclic N-Benzamido Imides with Potent Activity against Vaccinia Virus

abstract.text: ]octane-1-carboxylic acid, 2a: A mixture of anhydride 1 (103 mg, 0.50 mmol), 4-trifluoromethylbenzoic acid hydrazide (102 mg, 0.50 mmol) and a drop of diisopropylethylamine in absolute EtOH (2 mL) was refluxed for 5 h. Upon cooling to room temperature, water (0.2 mL) was added. The precipitate was collected by filtration and washed with cold EtOH (2x2 mL) to give compound 2a as a white solid (176 mg, 86% yield): mp: 256−257 ºC;

The solution was concentrated in vacuo to give compound 3a, as a white solid (146 mg, 99% yield). An analytical sample of 3a was obtained by crystallization from CH 2 Cl 2 /pentane. mp: 217−218 ºC; 3283, 2963, 2901, 2868, 1787, 1726, 1694, 1518, 1496, 1482, 1406, 1381, 1325, 1275, 1169, 1130, 1064, 1015, 855, 816 ]undecane-2,4-dione, 3b: This compound was obtained in a similar manner to that described before for compound 3a. An analytical sample of 3i was obtained by crystallization from CH 2 Cl 2 . mp: 79−80 ºC; MHz, DMSO-d 6 ): =15.6 (CH 3 ) and 15.7 (CH 3 ) (C7-CH 3 and C8-CH 3 ), 50.9 (C) and 51.1 (C) (C7 and C8), 53.8 [C, C1(5)], 54.2 (CH 2 ) and 54.5 (CH 2 ) [C6(10) and C9 (11) 2942, 2890, 2868, 1787, 1724, 1685, 1510, 1474, 1387, 1309, 1290, 1258, 1208, 1142, 858, 816, 802, ]undecane-2,4-dione, 3j. A mixture of acetohydrazide (62 mg, 0.84 mmol), anhydride 1 (155 mg, 0.75 mmol) and a drop of diisopropylethylamine in absolute EtOH (2 mL) was refluxed for 6 h. Upon cooling to room temperature, water (0.2 mL) was added. The solution (ocassionally a suspension) was stored in the refrigerator overnight, and the precipitate was collected by filtration and washed with cold etOH (2x2 mL). The solid was suspended in xylene (5 mL) and heated under reflux for 24 h in Dean-Stark equipment. The solution was concentrated in vacuo to give compound 3j. An analytical sample of 3j was obtained by crystallization from CH 2 Cl 2 . mp: 236−237 ºC; 1 H NMR (500 MHz, DMSO-d 6 ): =1.19 [s, 6 H, C7(8)-CH 3 ], 1.74-1.77 (m, 2 H) and 1.82−1.90 (complex signal, 6 H) [6(10)-H  , 6(10)-H   9(11)-H  and 9(11)-H  ], 1.97 (s, 3 H CH 3 CO), 10.40 (s, 1 H, NH) ppm; 13 C NMR (100.6 MHz, DMSO-d 6 ): =15.6 (CH 3 ) and 15.7 (CH 3 ) (C7-CH 3 and C8-CH 3 ), 20.3 (CH 3 , CH 3 CO), 50.8 (C) and 51.0 (C) (C7 and C8), 53.6 [C, C1(5)], 54.1 (CH 2 ) and 54.5 (CH 2 ) [C6(10) and C9(11)], 167.7 (C, CH 3 -CONH), 173.9 [C, C2(4)] ppm; IR (KBr): = 3232, 3187, 2972, 2946, 2890, 2868, 1787, 1739, 1669, 1535, 1382, 1314, 1293, 1275, 1208, 1147, 1099, 1012, 984, 861, 819, 744 , 620 cm ]pentadeca-7,13-diene-2,4-dione), 7a: This compound was obtained in a similar manner to that described before for compound 3j. Starting from anhydride 5 (200 mg, 0.88 mmol) and 4-(trifluoromethyl)benzoic acid hydrazide (180 mg, 0.88 mmol), compound 7a was isolated as a white solid (285 mg, 78% yield). An analytical sample of 7a was obtained by crystallization from CH 2 Cl 2 /pentane. mp: 268−269 ºC; 3312, 3061, 2982, 1722, 1704, 1480, 1407, 1328, 1270, 1244, 1163, 1134, 1117, 1067, 1017, 854, 822, 774, 702 cm ]pentadeca-7,13-diene-2,4-dione, 7b: This compound was obtained in a similar manner to that described before for compound 3j. (1r, 5s, 6R, 7R, 9S, 10S, 11s, 12r, 13S, 14S, 16R, ]heptadecane-2,4-dione, 8s: This compound was obtained as described before for 8a. Starting from benzamide 7s (80 mg, 0.17 mmol), compound 8s was isolated as a white solid (85 mg, quantitative yield). An analytical sample of 8s was obtained by crystallization from a mixture CH 2 Cl 2 /hexane. mp: 265−266 ºC (dec.); 1 H NMR (500 MHz, DMSO-d 6 ): =2.14 (broad s, 2 H, 11-H and 12-H), 3.33 (broad s, 4 H, 6(10)-H and 13 (17) 3272, 2946, 2924, 2855, 1791, 1734, 1458, 1382, 1280, 1184, 1136, 852, (14) 3325, 2959, 2875, 1781, 1720, 1700, 1521, 1476, 1329, 1287, 1270, 1163, 1143, 1120, 1093, 1068, 849 (6)], 129.6 (C, Ar-C1), 137.5 (C, Ar-C4), 163.4 (C, CONH), 173.5 [C, C2(4)] ppm; IR (KBr): = 3296, 2968, 2948, 2872, 1781, 1719, 1693, 1598, 1507, 1476, 1399, 1286, 1271, 1140, 1093, 848, ]heptadecane-2,4-dione, 10: Excess of an ethereal solution of diazomethane (100 mL) was added to a mixture of anhydride 5 (200 mg, 0.88 mmol) and Pd(OAc) 2 (5 mg, 0.02 mmol) and the suspension was stirred overnight at room temperature. The mixture was filtered and the filtrate was dried with anhydrous Na 2 SO 4 and concentrated in vacuo to give a yellow solid, that was subjected to silica gel column chromatography (hexane/EtOAc mixtures). Upon elution with hexane/EtOAc 95:5, anhydride 10 (220 mg, 98% yield) was obtained as a white solid. An analytical sample of 10 was obtained by crystallization from a mixture CH 2 Cl 2 /pentane. mp: 180 ºC (sublimes); ]heptadecane-2,4-dione, 12a: This compound was obtained in a similar manner to that described before for compound 3j. Starting from anhydride 10 (200 mg, 0.79 mmol) and 4-(trifluoromethyl)benzoic acid hydrazide (162 mg, 0.79 mmol), compound 12a was isolated as a white solid (182 mg, 52% yield).
